issue.title: [fund.ts.v2] ALLOCATOR_OF for function::operator= has incorrect default

discussion.p: According to the table in , if no allocator argument is specified at the time of construction, the memory resource pointer used is the value of experimental::pmr::get_default_resource() at the time of construction.

Yet in , ALLOCATOR_OF is specified to return allocator<char>() if no allocator was specified at the time of construction, which seems incorrect, especially as the user can change the default memory resource pointer to something other than new_delete_resource().
Daniel adjusts wording to lib. fund. v2.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4529.
